page.title: 03Cattle Farming on Horse-Eye
page.content: On Horse-Eye Level one of the 2 main types of animal farming is the cattle. The cattle grazed on the marsh are the Belted Galloway, Charolais & Friesians. Friesians are milked both in the morning and evening as well as farmed for their beef. The Belted Galloway & the Charolais are not milked & only farmed for their beef. The beef calves often run in the fields with the cows. The fields occupied by the cattle are sometimes separated by dykes - water ditches - instead of hedges or fences. In exceptionally dry weather, the dykes dry up allowing the cattle to escape. The cattle are expected to remain on the marsh in most weather conditions, although if too cold or wet they would be taken in. There does not appear to be any intensive feeding of the cattle in this area.
